intro: Tovomita frigida, commonly known as the cold mountain orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers with a unique coloration pattern. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a short, erect stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
